sentences.english: Weekly con calls will be setup to monitor progress along with documentation of deliverables.
sentences.chinese: 除了交付的文件，每週還要舉行電話會談以監督進程。

sentences.english: She is very religious and goes to church three times a week.
sentences.chinese: 她非常虔誠，每週去教堂三次。

sentences.english: Are you getting a dozen email newsletters delivered to your inbox on a daily or weekly basis?
sentences.chinese: 每日或每週時事資訊郵件？

sentences.english: They pick up our trash twice a week.
sentences.chinese: 他們每週兩次來收垃圾。

sentences.english: Restore luster to the skin, the beauty parlor every week or self-massage time.
sentences.chinese: 令肌膚恢復光澤，每週可以到美容院或自行按摩一次。

sentences.english: Suggest complete five-day-per-week mobility — the boss will go for it.
sentences.chinese: 建議每週有五天機動日，老闆會同意的。

sentences.english: Did you memorize the weekly sentence?
sentences.chinese: 你有把每週一句背下來嗎？

sentences.english: We publish about 35 letters each week.
sentences.chinese: 我們每週大約發表35封信件。

sentences.english: The school has a television club that produces weekly programs on different subjects.
sentences.chinese: 學校有一個電視俱樂部，每週會製作不同主題的節目。

sentences.english: Jane visited her mother every Sunday afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 每週日下午簡都有去看望她的母親。

sentences.english: Likewise, Sussman reads his newsweekly cover-to-cover every week.
sentences.chinese: 蘇斯曼同樣是每週都從頭到尾地閱讀新聞週刊。

sentences.english: Massage therapists and fitness trainers work fewer hours per week than any other professionals.
sentences.chinese: 按摩師和健身教練每週的工作時間比其他職業都要少。

sentences.english: Eat fish at least once a week.
sentences.chinese: 每週保證有一餐魚肉進膳。

sentences.english: Also, mop your bathroom floor once a week with a bleach-based cleanser.
sentences.chinese: 每週還應用漂白清潔劑擦拭浴室地板。

sentences.english: Now he surfs three or four times a week.
sentences.chinese: 現在他每週都去衝浪三四次。

sentences.english: Machine please drain valve is opened more than two times a week.
sentences.chinese: 機臺請每週打開排污閥兩次以上。

definition: to fix a time/fixed time/timed (of explosive etc)
number of times/frequency/order number (in a series)/power (math.)/degree of a polynomial (math.)
